msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

To make RichText more lightweight, it now uses the same technique as RichEditableText2 for its TLF hostFormat. In particular, it uses an object which is not actually a TextLayoutFormat, but instead simply implements ITextLayoutFormat by pulling the format properties directly from the component's CSS styles using getStyle(). This object is now implemented in a new CSSTextLayoutFormat class. It is smaller because it has only one var (for the object to call getStyle() on) rather than a var for every format property.

Also, the code in SimpleText, RichText, and RichEditableText2 for handling embedded fonts is now more uniform; all three classes use an identical getEmbeddedFontContext() method, which can eventually be factored into a base class or utility class after we determine the constellation of text classes that we'll ship with. I also made this code more efficient by using only a static instance of EmbeddedFont and TextFormat.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Vellum Build 419 plus one more API change.
Improve and optimize the RichText content getter for the case where it needs to convert the text to a text flow.
QE Notes: TextGraphic styles tests still pass
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
API changes for Vellum Build 418 + fixes.  The swcs are from Rich's private build.
InputManager constructor takes a config argument
TextLineFactory -> split into StringTextLineFactory and TextFlowTextLineFactory

QE Notes: I expect 40+ RichText tests to fail.  These tests would be ones that set the text property to a multiline value.  If text is set, the TextFlow will be a single paragraph with a single span with exactly the text specified.  If there is whitespace and line breaks in the text, they will remain, regardless of the style settings.  Setting content uses the markup-importing process, so depending on the style settings, whitespace may get collapsed and newlines may be treated as paragraph separators so that you end up with multiple paragraphs.
Doc Notes:  We need to doc the difference between setting text and setting content.

TextLineCreator went away.  If null, the default TextLineCreator will be used.
Reviewers: Gordon/Jim asked me to do this.

Fix more bugs related to embedded fonts and TLF, including TLF in an RSL.

Temporary fix to allow RichText to be parented by non-UIComponents so the FXG compiler work can continue.  However, a solution for handling embedded fonts in that configuration still needs to be determined.
